areaSection: Moraira is a sophisticated coastal jewel nestled on the northern coast of the Costa Blanca, between Jávea and Teulada in the Alicante province. This charming seaside village enjoys a privileged Mediterranean microclimate with over 300 days of annual sunshine and mild winters that make year-round living genuinely comfortable. The dramatic rocky coastline, punctuated by pristine coves and hidden beaches, creates a landscape of extraordinary natural beauty. Unlike busier Costa Blanca resorts, Moraira maintains an elegant, understated character—a place where quality of life takes precedence over mass tourism. The historic fishing village retains authentic Spanish charm while hosting a refined international community that has shaped its upmarket, peaceful atmosphere.
lifestyleSection: Life in Moraira revolves around the rhythm of Mediterranean leisure. Your days blend sandy beaches with waterfront dining, where fresh seafood and local wines set the mood for unhurried afternoons. The village attracts a discerning mix of British, German, and Dutch expats who value sophistication and tranquility over party scenes. Fridays bring the weekly market alive with local produce, fresh fish, and artisan goods—a genuine glimpse of Spanish coastal living. Modern amenities surround you: Mercadona and Consum supermarkets stock everything needed, while excellent private healthcare clinics and the nearby Hospital de Dénia ensure peace of mind. The expat community has cultivated outstanding restaurants, cozy cafés, and cultural venues that cater to international tastes without sacrificing authenticity. Whether you're relaxing at El Portet's Blue Flag beach, exploring hidden coves, or enjoying tapas overlooking the marina, Moraira delivers the authentic Mediterranean lifestyle that holiday home owners crave.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Living in Moraira means seamless access to everything you need for comfortable coastal living. From world-class healthcare to international education and convenient shopping, this sophisticated village combines Mediterranean charm with modern conveniences that cater to discerning international residents.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Moraira exceeds expectations for a village of its size. The Centro de Salud Teulada-Moraira provides primary care with staff experienced in serving international residents. For specialist care, Hospital de Dénia is just 25 minutes away, offering modern facilities and English-speaking physicians. Moraira hosts several excellent private clinics staffed by internationally trained doctors who cater specifically to English, German, and Dutch-speaking patients. Emergency services are well-organized with rapid response times. Many residents appreciate the quality of private healthcare at prices significantly lower than northern European equivalents, combining accessibility with affordability.

education.text: Families with children benefit from several excellent international schools within short driving distance. Lady Elizabeth School, just 15 minutes away, offers British curriculum education in a supportive international environment. Laude Newton College, 40 minutes distant, provides British-style education through secondary level. These schools attract families from across northern Costa Blanca and maintain high academic standards while fostering multicultural learning environments. The local Spanish schools are also highly regarded and increasingly popular with expat families seeking Spanish language immersion.

shopping.text: Shopping in Moraira caters to all requirements from daily essentials to specialty items. Mercadona, Consum, and Masymas supermarkets stock international products alongside local Spanish goods, making it simple to recreate familiar cuisines or explore Mediterranean ingredients. The Friday weekly market brings local farmers, fishermen, and artisans to the village center with fresh produce, caught-that-morning seafood, and handmade goods. For larger shopping needs, the nearby towns of Teulada and Jávea offer expanded retail centers within 10-15 minutes. This blend of village convenience and regional accessibility ensures you're never without what you need.

transport.text: Moraira is best explored with personal transport, as is typical for coastal villages. Alicante International Airport, 90 minutes south, offers direct flights to major European cities, making weekend getaways and family visits convenient. Local buses connect Moraira to nearby towns, though frequency is limited—most residents find a car essential for the independence and flexibility coastal living offers. The village itself is compact and walkable, with good road access to neighboring towns like Jávea, Teulada, and Denia. Parking is plentiful and unrestricted, adding to the ease of local living.

faqs.question: Are there restrictions on foreign property ownership?
faqs.answer: Spain welcomes foreign property ownership with minimal restrictions. EU citizens, UK residents, and international buyers can purchase property directly without special permits. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), property lawyer representation, and completion through a notary. Ownership is straightforward and fully legal. Many international owners successfully manage properties from abroad through management companies and digital tools.

faqs.question: What is the climate like in Moraira year-round?
faqs.answer: Moraira enjoys a Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of annual sunshine. Summers (June-September) are warm and dry with average temperatures around 28°C, perfect for beach activities. Winters (December-February) are mild with average temperatures around 12-15°C—cold by Mediterranean standards but warm compared to northern Europe. Spring and autumn offer ideal conditions with comfortable temperatures and fewer tourists. This climate supports year-round outdoor living and makes Moraira genuinely pleasant in every season.
